name: W Washington DC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The W hotel is very well located to many DC attractions. It tries very hard to be a hip locale - and I think it succeeds. It's very modern from the lobby to the rooms. Our room was on the 10th floor and we had an excellent view of the city. I also liked the Bliss bath products they provided. HOWEVER, our superb view did not make up for the fact that we had to endure listening to the music and incessant drum beat coming from the 11th floor bar until midnight each night and 3 a.m. on Friday. Ear plugs were provided - but they did nothing to keep out the noise. Plus we were near the elevators and we could hear the dinging each time a car arrived (not to mention people talking). Lastly, our phone kept beeping - we finally had to take out the battery. We complained about the phone and the bar noise and the receptionist was eager to say they'd fix it - but nothing improved. If you stay here - unless you're a young bar-goer, stay out late or a heavy sleeper - I suggest asks for a lower room, away from the elevators.
reviews.title: Lot of Pomp but lacks service

reviews.text: The W might just be the coolest place I've ever stayed. All of the facilities are gorgeous, modern, and thoughtfully decorated (and clean), the views are incredible, and the service is absolutely fantastic. J&G Steakhouse has some of the tastiest food in the entire world, and if you want a really good cocktail there are no better bartenders anywhere.
reviews.title: This place rocks!!!

reviews.text: Yes, the lobby can get crowded and a bit chaotic (though the people-watching is always fun) and in the rooms it can be a challenge to figure out how to turn on the modern lighting fixtures, but it is an absolutely fantastic and beautiful place to stay.
reviews.title: Tired and Need of Upgrades

reviews.text: Be aware, also, that while the location is very convenient to the National Mall, and to the heart of DC, it is not terribly close to a wide range of shopping and dining options.
reviews.title: Great Location/Small Room/Worth the Stay

reviews.text: Good thing I am A Starwood Plat, otherwise my room could be worse? Small room, definitely in need of some upgrades. Very noisy with the rooftop bar at night. These days I might not be a big fan of W hotels in general but this is definitely one of their lesser properties.
reviews.title: Just didn't live up to the expectations.

reviews.text: So I traditionally only stay in Starwood properties since I know what I'm going to get once I arrive.
reviews.title: Traveling Man lands in DC for a week stay!

reviews.text: This trip to DC had me staying up the street from my last stay (4 Points) @ the W.
reviews.title: W Washington DC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love the style and feel the W and of course the view is worth the price of admission.
reviews.title: Glamorous Boutique Feel

reviews.text: Special thanks to Clare - Front Desk Services who went above and beyond to ensure my stay was great. She greeted me with a smile and always asked how my day was and what could she do to make it better! Class Employee!
reviews.title: Perfect location, perfect hotel

reviews.text: Also thanks to Nomar - on the rooftop lounge who made sure their award winning breakfast buffet met my expectations.
reviews.title: Cool and trendy, but comes with an attitude and some noise.

reviews.text: While I will agree with the reviewer who said the halls are dark (ours was very dark), the rooms were light and airy and very comfortable. Every one of the staff we dealt with from bellhops, to doormen, to front counter and concierge gave us excellent service. We didn't have any room service, so I can't speak to that. The location was fabulous! We weren't in town all that long, but the proximity to the White House made it fun because we were able to "drop by" there several times. We could walk to all the monuments and even to the Capitol. I had one wrong charge on my bill and it was taken care of quickly.
reviews.title: We Loved It

reviews.text: I made sure ahead of time that we were nowhere near the disco and we had no noise troubles at all. They accommodated all of my requests.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of July. The hotel is perfectly located for all of the tourist activities (right across the road from the White House, around the corner from one of the main open bus tours pick up points, and walking distance to the majority of museums). We also felt very safe walking around in this area early morning and late night.
reviews.title: Dark, Dingy, Loud, Obnoxious, and Unfriendly

reviews.text: The hotel's reception area is quite impressive and the service is very friendly. We thought it might be very posh and a bit pretentious, but we didn't feel this when we were there. There are a mix of tourists and business people roaming around.
reviews.title: My #1 Hotel When I Stay In DC

reviews.text: The room itself is average - great facilities (gown, toiletries), very comfy beds, good shower - the reason I say average rather than great is because the room was slightly run down and not as clean as I'd have expected given the price of a room. We were out most of the time so this didn't affect us.
reviews.title: ...a nice property

reviews.text: While taking in the 100th year anniversary celebration of my beloved sorority, I had the opportunity to meet one of my former roommate there. We were whisked by elevator to the top floor. It was early evening in the midst of a heat wave that had struck the city. So the sun was still up and the lounge, which is open air was beginning to cool.
reviews.title: Visited rooftop lounge and was floored! This is good

reviews.text: It was not until sunset, when the lights began to come on at the monument and the White House that I got the full impact of why folks love to gather there. As cooling breezes began to blow through and an unusual mix of friendly good natured characters arrive, I realized I was sitting in one of the truly unique spots in D.C.
reviews.title: POV lounge
High expectations - and I'm writing my first ever review within an hour of checking in... :(
reviews.text: Make a reservation to snare one of the tables right next to the open air view of the White House, National Airport, National Cathedral, etc. So the drinks are $15+; the view is priceless. We were there when a summer storm came rolling in and got to see it unfold before our eyes (the outdoor space has clear plastic "shades" to protect you from the rain). We averaged about one drink per hour and no one pushed us out. So go ahead---gawk at the beauty of our nation's capital!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm British. I hate complaining. I really do. But I've stayed in some lovely hotels in DC, like the Palomar and the Sofitel Lafayette Square and I'm really disappointed with the W.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm here for 9 nights as a treat for my 40th. The W has a good reputation.
reviews.title: Good, but not quite a 5 Star hotel

description: This Washington DC Hotel is located in the heart of the city with convenient access to all of the great locations in DC. The W Washington DC Hotel looks forward to welcoming you.
